workout_title: Bigger Biceps and Defined Back Workout

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Swing arms forward and backward in a controlled manner. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: Grip the bar with a wide grip.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: Grip the attachment with palms facing each other.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement for maximum back engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: Pull the weight towards your chest while keeping your chest against the pad.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet on the platform and knees slightly bent.
alternative_exercise_execution: Grip the handle with both hands.
Pull the handle towards your torso while keeping your back straight.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows close to your body and focus on squeezing your back muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
execution: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down.
Maintain high tension in the stretched position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand facing away from a low cable machine with a handle attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: Grip the handle with one hand.
Curl the handle towards your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows locked in place to prevent cheating and maximize biceps engagement.

exercises.setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
execution: Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your body.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand, arms hanging down.
alternative_exercise_execution: Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows stationary.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a neutral grip throughout the movement to effectively target the brachialis.
